section.title: report.py
section.programlisting:
00001 # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- 00002 # Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions. 00003 # See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information. 00004 # SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception 00005 """ This module is responsible to generate 'index.html' for the report. 00006 00007 The input for this step is the output directory, where individual reports 00008 could be found. It parses those reports and generates 'index.html'. """ 00009 00010 import re 00011 import os 00012 import os.path 00013 import sys 00014 import shutil 00015 import plistlib 00016 import glob 00017 import json 00018 import logging 00019 import datetime 00020 from libscanbuild import duplicate_check 00021 from libscanbuild.clang import get_version 00022 00023 __all__ = ['document'] 00024 00025 00026 def document(args): 00027 """ Generates cover report and returns the number of bugs/crashes. """ 00028 00029 html_reports_available = args.output_format in {'html', 'plist-html', 'sarif-html'} 00030 sarif_reports_available = args.output_format in {'sarif', 'sarif-html'} 00031 00032 logging.debug('count crashes and bugs') 00033 crash_count = sum(1 for _ in read_crashes(args.output)) 00034 bug_counter = create_counters() 00035 for bug in read_bugs(args.output, html_reports_available): 00036 bug_counter(bug) 00037 result = crash_count + bug_counter.total 00038 00039 if html_reports_available and result: 00040 use_cdb = os.path.exists(args.cdb) 00041 00042 logging.debug('generate index.html file') 00043 # common prefix for source files to have sorter path 00044 prefix = commonprefix_from(args.cdb) if use_cdb else os.getcwd() 00045 # assemble the cover from multiple fragments 00046 fragments = [] 00047 try: 00048 if bug_counter.total: 00049 fragments.append(bug_summary(args.output, bug_counter)) 00050 fragments.append(bug_report(args.output, prefix)) 00051 if crash_count: 00052 fragments.append(crash_report(args.output, prefix)) 00053 assemble_cover(args, prefix, fragments) 00054 # copy additional files to the report 00055 copy_resource_files(args.output) 00056 if use_cdb: 00057 shutil.copy(args.cdb, args.output) 00058 finally: 00059 for fragment in fragments: 00060 os.remove(fragment) 00061 00062 if sarif_reports_available: 00063 logging.debug('merging sarif files') 00064 merge_sarif_files(args.output) 00065 00066 return result 00067 00068 00069 def assemble_cover(args, prefix, fragments): 00070 """ Put together the fragments into a final report. """ 00071 00072 import getpass 00073 import socket 00074 00075 if args.html_title is None: 00076 args.html_title = os.path.basename(prefix) + ' - analyzer results' 00077 00078 with open(os.path.join(args.output, 'index.html'), 'w') as handle: 00079 indent = 0 00080 handle.write(reindent(""" 00081 | 00082 | 00083 | 00084 | {html_title} 00085 | 00086 | 00087 | 00088 | """, indent).format(html_title=args.html_title)) 00089 handle.write(comment('SUMMARYENDHEAD')) 00090 handle.write(reindent(""" 00091 | 00092 |

{html_title}

00093 | 00094 | 00095 | 00096 | 00097 | 00098 | 00099 |
User:{user_name}@{host_name}
Working Directory:{current_dir}
Command Line:{cmd_args}
Clang Version:{clang_version}
Date:{date}
""", indent).format(html_title=args.html_title, 00100 user_name=getpass.getuser(), 00101 host_name=socket.gethostname(), 00102 current_dir=prefix, 00103 cmd_args=' '.join(sys.argv), 00104 clang_version=get_version(args.clang), 00105 date=datetime.datetime.today( 00106 ).strftime('%c'))) 00107 for fragment in fragments: 00108 # copy the content of fragments 00109 with open(fragment, 'r') as input_handle: 00110 shutil.copyfileobj(input_handle, handle) 00111 handle.write(reindent(""" 00112 | 00113 |""", indent)) 00114 00115 00116 def bug_summary(output_dir, bug_counter): 00117 """ Bug summary is a HTML table to give a better overview of the bugs. """ 00118 00119 name = os.path.join(output_dir, 'summary.html.fragment') 00120 with open(name, 'w') as handle: 00121 indent = 4 00122 handle.write(reindent(""" 00123 |

Bug Summary

00124 | 00125 | 00126 | 00127 | 00128 | 00129 | 00130 | 00131 | 00132 | """, indent)) 00133 handle.write(reindent(""" 00134 | 00135 | 00136 | 00137 | 00143 | """, indent).format(bug_counter.total)) 00144 for category, types in bug_counter.categories.items(): 00145 handle.write(reindent(""" 00146 | 00147 | 00148 | """, indent).format(category)) 00149 for bug_type in types.values(): 00150 handle.write(reindent(""" 00151 | 00152 | 00153 | 00154 | 00160 | """, indent).format(**bug_type)) 00161 handle.write(reindent(""" 00162 | 00163 |
Bug TypeQuantityDisplay?
All Bugs{0} 00138 |
00139 | 00141 |
00142 |
{0}
{bug_type}{bug_count} 00155 |
00156 | 00158 |
00159 |
""", indent)) 00164 handle.write(comment('SUMMARYBUGEND')) 00165 return name 00166 00167 00168 def bug_report(output_dir, prefix): 00169 """ Creates a fragment from the analyzer reports. """ 00170 00171 pretty = prettify_bug(prefix, output_dir) 00172 bugs = (pretty(bug) for bug in read_bugs(output_dir, True)) 00173 00174 name = os.path.join(output_dir, 'bugs.html.fragment') 00175 with open(name, 'w') as handle: 00176 indent = 4 00177 handle.write(reindent(""" 00178 |

Reports

00179 | 00180 | 00181 | 00182 | 00183 | 00187 | 00188 | 00189 | 00190 | 00191 | 00192 | 00193 | 00194 | """, indent)) 00195 handle.write(comment('REPORTBUGCOL')) 00196 for current in bugs: 00197 handle.write(reindent(""" 00198 | 00199 | 00200 | 00201 | 00202 | 00203 | 00204 | 00205 | 00206 | """, indent).format(**current)) 00207 handle.write(comment('REPORTBUG', {'id': current['report_file']})) 00208 handle.write(reindent(""" 00209 | 00210 |
Bug Group 00184 | Bug Type 00185 |  ▾ 00186 | FileFunction/MethodLinePath Length
{bug_category}{bug_type}{bug_file}{bug_function}{bug_line}{bug_path_length}View Report
""", indent)) 00211 handle.write(comment('REPORTBUGEND')) 00212 return name 00213 00214 00215 def crash_report(output_dir, prefix): 00216 """ Creates a fragment from the compiler crashes. """ 00217 00218 pretty = prettify_crash(prefix, output_dir) 00219 crashes = (pretty(crash) for crash in read_crashes(output_dir)) 00220 00221 name = os.path.join(output_dir, 'crashes.html.fragment') 00222 with open(name, 'w') as handle: 00223 indent = 4 00224 handle.write(reindent(""" 00225 |

Analyzer Failures

00226 |

The analyzer had problems processing the following files:

00227 | 00228 | 00229 | 00230 | 00231 | 00232 | 00233 | 00234 | 00235 | 00236 | """, indent)) 00237 for current in crashes: 00238 handle.write(reindent(""" 00239 | 00240 | 00241 | 00242 | 00243 | 00244 | """, indent).format(**current)) 00245 handle.write(comment('REPORTPROBLEM', current)) 00246 handle.write(reindent(""" 00247 | 00248 |
ProblemSource FilePreprocessed FileSTDERR Output
{problem}{source}preprocessor outputanalyzer std err
""", indent)) 00249 handle.write(comment('REPORTCRASHES')) 00250 return name 00251 00252 00253 def read_crashes(output_dir): 00254 """ Generate a unique sequence of crashes from given output directory. """ 00255 00256 return (parse_crash(filename) 00257 for filename in glob.iglob(os.path.join(output_dir, 'failures', 00258 '*.info.txt'))) 00259 00260 00261 def read_bugs(output_dir, html): 00262 # type: (str, bool) -> Generator[Dict[str, Any], None, None] 00263 """ Generate a unique sequence of bugs from given output directory. 00264 00265 Duplicates can be in a project if the same module was compiled multiple 00266 times with different compiler options. These would be better to show in 00267 the final report (cover) only once. """ 00268 00269 def empty(file_name): 00270 return os.stat(file_name).st_size == 0 00271 00272 duplicate = duplicate_check( 00273 lambda bug: '{bug_line}.{bug_path_length}:{bug_file}'.format(**bug)) 00274 00275 # get the right parser for the job. 00276 parser = parse_bug_html if html else parse_bug_plist 00277 # get the input files, which are not empty. 00278 pattern = os.path.join(output_dir, '*.html' if html else '*.plist') 00279 bug_files = (file for file in glob.iglob(pattern) if not empty(file)) 00280 00281 for bug_file in bug_files: 00282 for bug in parser(bug_file): 00283 if not duplicate(bug): 00284 yield bug 00285 00286 def merge_sarif_files(output_dir, sort_files=False): 00287 """ Reads and merges all .sarif files in the given output directory. 00288 00289 Each sarif file in the output directory is understood as a single run 00290 and thus appear separate in the top level runs array. This requires 00291 modifying the run index of any embedded links in messages. 00292 """ 00293 00294 def empty(file_name): 00295 return os.stat(file_name).st_size == 0 00296 00297 def update_sarif_object(sarif_object, runs_count_offset): 00298 """ 00299 Given a SARIF object, checks its dictionary entries for a 'message' property. 00300 If it exists, updates the message index of embedded links in the run index. 00301 00302 Recursively looks through entries in the dictionary. 00303 """ 00304 if not isinstance(sarif_object, dict): 00305 return sarif_object 00306 00307 if 'message' in sarif_object: 00308 sarif_object['message'] = match_and_update_run(sarif_object['message'], runs_count_offset) 00309 00310 for key in sarif_object: 00311 if isinstance(sarif_object[key], list): 00312 # iterate through subobjects and update it. 00313 arr = [update_sarif_object(entry, runs_count_offset) for entry in sarif_object[key]] 00314 sarif_object[key] = arr 00315 elif isinstance(sarif_object[key], dict): 00316 sarif_object[key] = update_sarif_object(sarif_object[key], runs_count_offset) 00317 else: 00318 # do nothing 00319 pass 00320 00321 return sarif_object 00322 00323 00324 def match_and_update_run(message, runs_count_offset): 00325 """ 00326 Given a SARIF message object, checks if the text property contains an embedded link and 00327 updates the run index if necessary. 00328 """ 00329 if 'text' not in message: 00330 return message 00331 00332 # we only merge runs, so we only need to update the run index 00333 pattern = re.compile(r'sarif:/runs/(\d+)') 00334 00335 text = message['text'] 00336 matches = re.finditer(pattern, text) 00337 matches_list = list(matches) 00338 00339 # update matches from right to left to make increasing character length (9->10) smoother 00340 for idx in range(len(matches_list) - 1, -1, -1): 00341 match = matches_list[idx] 00342 new_run_count = str(runs_count_offset + int(match.group(1))) 00343 text = text[0:match.start(1)] + new_run_count + text[match.end(1):] 00344 00345 message['text'] = text 00346 return message 00347 00348 00349 00350 sarif_files = (file for file in glob.iglob(os.path.join(output_dir, '*.sarif')) if not empty(file)) 00351 # exposed for testing since the order of files returned by glob is not guaranteed to be sorted 00352 if sort_files: 00353 sarif_files = list(sarif_files) 00354 sarif_files.sort() 00355 00356 runs_count = 0 00357 merged = {} 00358 for sarif_file in sarif_files: 00359 with open(sarif_file) as fp: 00360 sarif = json.load(fp) 00361 if 'runs' not in sarif: 00362 continue 00363 00364 # start with the first file 00365 if not merged: 00366 merged = sarif 00367 else: 00368 # extract the run and append it to the merged output 00369 for run in sarif['runs']: 00370 new_run = update_sarif_object(run, runs_count) 00371 merged['runs'].append(new_run) 00372 00373 runs_count += len(sarif['runs']) 00374 00375 with open(os.path.join(output_dir, 'results-merged.sarif'), 'w') as out: 00376 json.dump(merged, out, indent=4, sort_keys=True) 00377 00378 00379 def parse_bug_plist(filename): 00380 """ Returns the generator of bugs from a single .plist file. """ 00381 00382 with open(filename, 'rb') as fp: 00383 content = plistlib.load(fp) 00384 files = content.get('files') 00385 for bug in content.get('diagnostics', []): 00386 if len(files) <= int(bug['location']['file']): 00387 logging.warning('Parsing bug from "%s" failed', filename) 00388 continue 00389 00390 yield { 00391 'result': filename, 00392 'bug_type': bug['type'], 00393 'bug_category': bug['category'], 00394 'bug_line': int(bug['location']['line']), 00395 'bug_path_length': int(bug['location']['col']), 00396 'bug_file': files[int(bug['location']['file'])] 00397 } 00398 00399 00400 def parse_bug_html(filename): 00401 """ Parse out the bug information from HTML output. """ 00402 00403 patterns = [re.compile(r'$'), 00404 re.compile(r'$'), 00405 re.compile(r'$'), 00406 re.compile(r'$'), 00407 re.compile(r'$'), 00408 re.compile(r'$'), 00409 re.compile(r'$')] 00410 endsign = re.compile(r'') 00411 00412 bug = { 00413 'report_file': filename, 00414 'bug_function': 'n/a', # compatibility with < clang-3.5 00415 'bug_category': 'Other', 00416 'bug_line': 0, 00417 'bug_path_length': 1 00418 } 00419 00420 with open(filename) as handler: 00421 for line in handler.readlines(): 00422 # do not read the file further 00423 if endsign.match(line): 00424 break 00425 # search for the right lines 00426 for regex in patterns: 00427 match = regex.match(line.strip()) 00428 if match: 00429 bug.update(match.groupdict()) 00430 break 00431 00432 encode_value(bug, 'bug_line', int) 00433 encode_value(bug, 'bug_path_length', int) 00434 00435 yield bug 00436 00437 00438 def parse_crash(filename): 00439 """ Parse out the crash information from the report file. """ 00440 00441 match = re.match(r'(.*)\.info\.txt', filename) 00442 name = match.group(1) if match else None 00443 with open(filename, mode='rb') as handler: 00444 # this is a workaround to fix windows read '\r\n' as new lines. 00445 lines = [line.decode().rstrip() for line in handler.readlines()] 00446 return { 00447 'source': lines[0], 00448 'problem': lines[1], 00449 'file': name, 00450 'info': name + '.info.txt', 00451 'stderr': name + '.stderr.txt' 00452 } 00453 00454 00455 def category_type_name(bug): 00456 """ Create a new bug attribute from bug by category and type. 00457 00458 The result will be used as CSS class selector in the final report. """ 00459 00460 def smash(key): 00461 """ Make value ready to be HTML attribute value. """ 00462 00463 return bug.get(key, '').lower().replace(' ', '_').replace("'", '') 00464 00465 return escape('bt_' + smash('bug_category') + '_' + smash('bug_type')) 00466 00467 00468 def create_counters(): 00469 """ Create counters for bug statistics. 00470 00471 Two entries are maintained: 'total' is an integer, represents the 00472 number of bugs. The 'categories' is a two level categorisation of bug 00473 counters. The first level is 'bug category' the second is 'bug type'. 00474 Each entry in this classification is a dictionary of 'count', 'type' 00475 and 'label'. """ 00476 00477 def predicate(bug): 00478 bug_category = bug['bug_category'] 00479 bug_type = bug['bug_type'] 00480 current_category = predicate.categories.get(bug_category, dict()) 00481 current_type = current_category.get(bug_type, { 00482 'bug_type': bug_type, 00483 'bug_type_class': category_type_name(bug), 00484 'bug_count': 0 00485 }) 00486 current_type.update({'bug_count': current_type['bug_count'] + 1}) 00487 current_category.update({bug_type: current_type}) 00488 predicate.categories.update({bug_category: current_category}) 00489 predicate.total += 1 00490 00491 predicate.total = 0 00492 predicate.categories = dict() 00493 return predicate 00494 00495 00496 def prettify_bug(prefix, output_dir): 00497 def predicate(bug): 00498 """ Make safe this values to embed into HTML. """ 00499 00500 bug['bug_type_class'] = category_type_name(bug) 00501 00502 encode_value(bug, 'bug_file', lambda x: escape(chop(prefix, x))) 00503 encode_value(bug, 'bug_category', escape) 00504 encode_value(bug, 'bug_type', escape) 00505 encode_value(bug, 'report_file', lambda x: escape(chop(output_dir, x))) 00506 return bug 00507 00508 return predicate 00509 00510 00511 def prettify_crash(prefix, output_dir): 00512 def predicate(crash): 00513 """ Make safe this values to embed into HTML. """ 00514 00515 encode_value(crash, 'source', lambda x: escape(chop(prefix, x))) 00516 encode_value(crash, 'problem', escape) 00517 encode_value(crash, 'file', lambda x: escape(chop(output_dir, x))) 00518 encode_value(crash, 'info', lambda x: escape(chop(output_dir, x))) 00519 encode_value(crash, 'stderr', lambda x: escape(chop(output_dir, x))) 00520 return crash 00521 00522 return predicate 00523 00524 00525 def copy_resource_files(output_dir): 00526 """ Copy the javascript and css files to the report directory. """ 00527 00528 this_dir = os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__)) 00529 for resource in os.listdir(os.path.join(this_dir, 'resources')): 00530 shutil.copy(os.path.join(this_dir, 'resources', resource), output_dir) 00531 00532 00533 def encode_value(container, key, encode): 00534 """ Run 'encode' on 'container[key]' value and update it. """ 00535 00536 if key in container: 00537 value = encode(container[key]) 00538 container.update({key: value}) 00539 00540 00541 def chop(prefix, filename): 00542 """ Create 'filename' from '/prefix/filename' """ 00543 00544 return filename if not len(prefix) else os.path.relpath(filename, prefix) 00545 00546 00547 def escape(text): 00548 """ Paranoid HTML escape method. (Python version independent) """ 00549 00550 escape_table = { 00551 '&': '&', 00552 '"': '"', 00553 "'": ''', 00554 '>': '>', 00555 '<': '<' 00556 } 00557 return ''.join(escape_table.get(c, c) for c in text) 00558 00559 00560 def reindent(text, indent): 00561 """ Utility function to format html output and keep indentation. """ 00562 00563 result = '' 00564 for line in text.splitlines(): 00565 if len(line.strip()): 00566 result += ' ' * indent + line.split('|')[1] + os.linesep 00567 return result 00568 00569 00570 def comment(name, opts=dict()): 00571 """ Utility function to format meta information as comment. """ 00572 00573 attributes = '' 00574 for key, value in opts.items(): 00575 attributes += ' {0}="{1}"'.format(key, value) 00576 00577 return '{2}'.format(name, attributes, os.linesep) 00578 00579 00580 def commonprefix_from(filename): 00581 """ Create file prefix from a compilation database entries. """ 00582 00583 with open(filename, 'r') as handle: 00584 return commonprefix(item['file'] for item in json.load(handle)) 00585 00586 00587 def commonprefix(files): 00588 """ Fixed version of os.path.commonprefix. 00589 00590 :param files: list of file names. 00591 :return: the longest path prefix that is a prefix of all files. """ 00592 result = None 00593 for current in files: 00594 if result is not None: 00595 result = os.path.commonprefix([result, current]) 00596 else: 00597 result = current 00598 00599 if result is None: 00600 return '' 00601 elif not os.path.isdir(result): 00602 return os.path.dirname(result) 00603 else: 00604 return os.path.abspath(result)
